iwork.eheap2
Class EventHeap

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.EventHeap
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventHeapConfigValues, FieldValueTypes, iwork.eheap2.net.NetConfigValues
public class EventHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventHeapConfigValues, iwork.eheap2.net.NetConfigValues, FieldValueTypes

This class provides an interface to an event heap in which the application is participating. An event heap is characterized by the server name for the machine on which it is running and the port being used on that machine.

Field Summary

Constructor Detail

EventHeap

public EventHeap(EventHeap oldHeap,
                 java.lang.String sourceName)
          throws EventHeapException
See the description for EventHeap(String, String, int, EventHeap, String, String, int). This constructor creates a new Event Heap with machine and port the same as for oldHeap. 'sourceName' must be different than in 'oldHeap', and sequencing of events from this Event Heap object will be independent of the original. It should be used to create a new EventHeap object that is connected to the same Event Heap. As with EventHeap(String, String, int, EventHeap, String, String), setting sourceName to null will cause a name to be created automatically based on the name of the application using the library.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if oldHeap is null.

                 java.lang.String machine)
See the description for EventHeap(String, String, int, EventHeap, String, String, int). This constructor calls that one with port=-1, oldHeap=null, timeout=-1.

EventHeap

public EventHeap(java.lang.String sourceName,
                 java.lang.String machine,
                 int port,
                 EventHeap oldHeap,

EventHeap

public EventHeap(java.lang.String sourceName,
                 java.lang.String machine,
                 int port,
                 EventHeap oldHeap,
                 java.lang.String deviceName,
                 java.lang.String applicationName,
                 int timeout)
Creates a new Event Heap interface to the specified event heap. The Event Heap which is connected is determined by the given machine and port. The SourceName specifies the 'Source' that will be used in all events sent from this EventHeap object. If another Event Heap is passed in, the machine and port parameters will be set to the values from it if those parameters are passed in as 'null' or '-1' (for port).

C++ API Note: The C++ API includes one more parameter, clientName. This parameter is ignored in the current implementation and is left in for legacy support.

Parameters:
sourceName - The 'Source' for all events generated by this object. It should be unique among all participants in the Event Heap. If it is null, a value will be generated based on the name of the application using the library and a random number.
machine - The DNS name of the machine where the Event Heap server is running. Leave as 'null' to use the value in oldHeap.

port - The port on the machine being used by the Event Heap server. Leave as -1 for default port.

oldHeap - Another Event Heap instance. Values for the other parameters are taken from here if this is non-null and they are set to 'null' or -1.
deviceName - The name of the device on which this Event Heap client is running. This will be added to events sent from this JVM. This is only set once per JVM, so if there is already a value set it is ignored. If null, the device name will be inferred from the DNS name or IP address of the device running the JVM.
applicationName - The name of the application in which this EventHeap client is being instantiated. This will be added to events sent from this JVM. This is only set once per JVM, so if there is already a value set it is ignored. If null, the application name will be inferred from the class name of the earliest class in the Java stack.
timeout - the time (in ms) to wait for the network socket interface to connect to the Event Heap. If it cannot do so, it will throw an EventHeapException. Pass in a value of -1 to continuously try connecting to the Event Heap (this is the traditional method of using the EventHeap class, and is still the only way under versions of Java before 1.4). Note that if you continuously try to connect and the socket interface cannot connect to the remote server (e.g. if no such server exists), then this thread will hang irreparably.

public void clear()
           throws EventHeapException
Clears all events from the Event Heap to which this object is connected.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server.

deleteEvent

public void deleteEvent(Event event)
                 throws EventHeapException
Permanently removes an event from the Event Heap. The event passed in should be one previously retrieved using one of the retrieval methods.

Parameters:
event - An event previously retrieved from the Event Heap.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

getAll

public Event[] getAll()
               throws EventHeapException
Returns the complete set of events currently in the Event Heap. No sequencing information is used or affected by this call.

Returns:
An array of events containing a copy of all events currently present in the Event Heap.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server.

getEvent

public Event[] getEvent(Event[] templateEvents)
                 throws EventHeapException
Gets an event matching one of the given template events from the Event Heap represented by this object. If no matching event is available it returns immediately with 'null'. In addition to the matching event it returns which template or templates matched.

Parameters:
templateEvents - The templates to be used in matching events in the Event Heap passed in as elements of an array. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
An array of events. The first element of the array is the next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches one or more of the given template events. Subsequent events in the array are the template events used for the match which matched the returned event. 'null' is returned if there are no matching events currently present.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

getEvent

public Event getEvent(Event templateEvent)
               throws EventHeapException
Gets an event matching the given template event from the Event Heap represented by this object. If no matching event is available it returns immediately with 'null'.

Parameters:
templateEvent - The template to be used in matching events in the Event Heap. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
The next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches the given template event. 'null' is returned if there are no matching events currently present.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

getServerName

public java.lang.String getServerName()
Returns a string representation of the machine/port of the Event Heap server to which this EventHeap client object is connected. The string is in the form of the remotes IP address followed by a ':' and the remote port (%d.%d.%d.%d:port)

Returns:
The IP Address:port string for the remote host

registerForAll

public EventRegistration registerForAll(EventCallback callback)
                                 throws EventHeapException
Registers to receive notification any time any event is posted to the Event Heap. Sequencing is ignored, and events retrieved via the callback do not effect sequencing of other events retrieved by this Event Heap object (i.e. even if an event is received in the callback method, it may be received again by the other retrieval methods). Callbacks will continue to be made to the specified object until EventRegistration.deregister() is called, or the callback routine returns false.

NOTE: Since every event sent to the Event Heap will be received when this method is used, it is resource intensive on both the server and client sides. It should be used sparingly and only when necessary (e.g. when a complete log of transactions through the Event Heap is needed). It is preferrable to use registerForEvents(Event [], EventCallback) whenever possible to receive only the subset of events needed.

Parameters:
callback - An object implementing the EventCallback interface. The returnEvent method of this object is called anytime an event is placed in the Event Heap. Note that although an array of events will be passed to the callback, since no templates are used for this notification stream, the array will contain a single element which is the event being returned.
Returns:
An EventRegistration object that is a reference to this registration for notification of events. Calling the deregister method on this object will stop event notification.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

registerForEvents

public EventRegistration registerForEvents(Event[] templateEvents,
                                           EventCallback callback)
                                    throws EventHeapException
Registers to receive notification any time an event matching one or more of the specified templates is posted to the Event Heap. Sequencing is ignored, and events retrieved via the callback do not effect sequencing of other events retrieved by this Event Heap object (i.e. even if an event is received in the callback method, it may be received again by the other retrieval methods). Callbacks will continue to be made to the specified object until EventRegistration.deregister() is called, or the callback routine returns false.

Parameters:
templateEvents - The templates to be used in matching events in the Event Heap passed in as elements of an array. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
callback - An object implementing the EventCallback interface. The returnEvent method of this object is called anytime a matching event is placed in the Event Heap.
Returns:
An EventRegistration object that is a reference to this registration for notification of events. Calling the deregister method on this object will stop event notification.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

removeEvent

public Event removeEvent(Event templateEvent)
                  throws EventHeapException
Removes an event matching the given template event from the Event Heap represented by this object. If no matching event is available it returns immediately with 'null'.

Parameters:
templateEvent - The template to be used in matching events in the Event Heap. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
The next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches the given template event. After retrieval the event will no longer be available in the Event Heap for others to retrieve. 'null' is returned if there are no matching events currently present.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

removeEvent

public Event[] removeEvent(Event[] templateEvents)
                    throws EventHeapException
Removes an event matching one of the given template events from the Event Heap represented by this object. If no matching event is available it returns immediately with 'null'. In addition to the matching event it returns which template or templates matched.

Parameters:
templateEvents - The templates to be used in matching events in the Event Heap passed in as elements of an array. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
An array of events. The first element of the array is the next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches one or more of the given template events. Subsequent events in the array are the template events used for the match which matched the returned event. After retrieval the events will no longer be available in the Event Heap for other to retrieve. 'null' is returned if there are no matching events currently present.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

setDebug

public static void setDebug(int level)
Sets the debug output level for the EventHeap for this process. All debug messages with level less than or equal to the current 'level' will be printed. A level of 1 or higher will cause a dump of all TSpaces calls made by the Event Heap to be printed.

Parameters:
level - the current debug level. Calls to debugPrintln(int, String) with level set to less than the debug level will be output.

setDebugStream

Sets the print stream to which to output debug information

setPerson

public void setPerson(java.lang.String name)
Set the person to whom all events generated by this EventHeap client object will be attributed, and for whom incoming events will be matched.

setServerTimeout

public void setServerTimeout(long timeout)
Set the server timeout. Calls to the Event Heap will return if they don't get a response before the timeout expires. In the case of a retrieve call, null will be returned. In the case of a put, the event is not guaranteed to have been successfully placed into the Event Heap.

NOTE: Currently the timeout is only how long the client will wait for the call to succeed through the underlying socket interface. If there is no connection to the server, the client will still block in calls forever trying to reconnect. This is a known bug.

Parameters:
timeout - The amount of time to wait for a response from the server in ms. 0 means wait forever. Negative values are not allowed.

snoopEvents

public Event[] snoopEvents(Event templateEvent)
                    throws EventHeapException
Returns all events matching the template event without modifying the contents of the Event Heap. This can be used to look at what is currently in the Event Heap without actually interacting. The events are returned in an array. No sequencing is done.

Parameters:
templateEvent - The template to be used in matching events in the Event Heap. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
An array of all events currently in the Event Heap that match the template event. The array is a set- there are no duplicate events- but the array is not guaranteed to be ordered.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

snoopEvents

public Event[] snoopEvents(Event[] templateEvents)
                    throws EventHeapException
Returns all events matching one or more of the given template events without modifying the contents of the Event Heap. This can be used to look at what is currently in the Event Heap without actually interacting. If no matching events are available it returns immediately with 'null'. The matching events are returned in an array, and the Tuple.matches(Tuple) method can be used to determine which template events actually match any given returned event. No sequencing is done.

Parameters:
templateEvents - The templates to be used in matching events in the Event Heap passed in as elements of an array. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
An array of all events currently in the Event Heap that match one of the template events. The array is a set- there are no duplicate events- but the array is not guaranteed to be ordered.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

waitToRemoveEvent

public Event waitToRemoveEvent(Event templateEvent)
                        throws EventHeapException
Removes an event matching the given template event from the Event Heap represented by this object. The call will block until a matching event is found.

Parameters:
templateEvent - The template to be used in matching events in the Event Heap. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
The next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches the given template event. The event will no longer be available in the Event Heap for others to use.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

waitToRemoveEvent

public Event[] waitToRemoveEvent(Event[] templateEvents)
                          throws EventHeapException
Removes an event matching one of the given template events from the Event Heap represented by this object. The call will block until a matching event is found. In addition to the matching event it returns which template or templates matched.

C++ API Note: The C++ API includes one more parameter, int *size, which is a pointer to the size of the templateEvents array being passed in. When the call returns the size parameter is changed to the size of the returned event array.

Parameters:
templateEvents - The templates to be used in matching events in the Event Heap passed in as elements of an array. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
An array of events. The first element of the array is the next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches one or more of the given template events. Subsequent events in the array are the template events used for the match which matched the returned event. The event retrieved will no longer be available in the Event Heap for others to use.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

waitForEvent

public Event waitForEvent(Event templateEvent)
                   throws EventHeapException
Retrieves an event matching the given template event from the Event Heap represented by this object. The call will block until a matching event is found.

Parameters:
templateEvent - The template to be used in matching events in the Event Heap. Only the field type, name and value of non-formal fields are used in the match. Field order is irrelevant.
Returns:
The next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches the given template event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

Returns:
An array of events. The first element of the array is the next most recent event in the Event Heap not yet retrieved by this object which matches one or more of the given template events. Subsequent events in the array are the template events used for the match which matched the returned event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was some non-recoverable problem communicating to the Event Heap server, or one or more events are malformed.

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Directly after a call to an EventHeap constructor with a timeout set to a value other than -1, a call to isConnected() will return whether or not a connection has been successfully established to the Event Heap. In all other situations its behavior is undefined.
